"ometimes I find myself wanting to use the `this` keyword when referring to my own code, especially inside a function. But I know that this is bad practice and can lead to confusing behavior later on. Is there any way to avoid using `this`?

Yes, you are correct that using `this` within your own code can be problematic and should generally be avoided whenever possible. Here are some strategies for writing clean and maintainable JavaScript without relying on `this`: 1. Use contextual references instead of `this`. Instead of binding `this` to a specific object or scope within a method, consider passing an explicit reference as an argument. For example, `` rather than `
